reasoning: Aggregate BOTEC estimate summing major reoviridae infections: Rotavirus (~8000 per 100k in children, major cause of gastroenteritis in developing countries), Colorado tick fever (~0.3 per 100k in endemic areas), Reovirus (~5 per 100k in immunocompromised), and other reoviruses (~500 per 100k). Rotavirus dominates global incidence due to high prevalence in pediatric populations in developing nations. Wide geographic and age-based variation.
